00026 #include "lpc17xx_ssp.h"

00032 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00038 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINTIONS *************************/
00039 /* Idle char */
00040 #define IDLE_CHAR       0xFF
00041 
00043 #define USEDSSPDEV_M            0
00044 
00046 #define USEDSSPDEV_S            1
00047 
00049 #define BUFFER_SIZE                     0x40
00050 
00051 /* These macro below is used in MiroWire Frame Format.
00052  * Since master in MicroWire Frame Format must send a Operation Command
00053  * to slave before each transmission between master and slave
00054  */
00055 /* Write command */
00056 #define MicroWire_WR_CMD        ((uint8_t)(0x00))
00057 /* Read command */
00058 #define MicroWire_RD_CMD        ((uint8_t)(0x01))
00059 
00060 
00061 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == USEDSSPDEV_S)
00062 #error "Master and Slave SSP device are duplicated!"
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 #if (USEDSSPDEV_M == 0)
00066 #define SSPDEV_M LPC_SSP0
00067 #elif (USEDSSPDEV_M == 1)
00068 #define SSPDEV_M LPC_SSP1
00069 #elif
00070 #error "Master SSP device not defined!"
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #if (USEDSSPDEV_S == 0)
00074 #define SSPDEV_S LPC_SSP0
00075 #elif (USEDSSPDEV_S == 1)
00076 #define SSPDEV_S LPC_SSP1
00077 #elif
00078 #error "Slave SSP device not defined!"
00079 #endif
00080 
00081 /* These variable below are used in Master SSP -------------------- */
00082 /* Read data pointer */
00083 uint8_t *pRdBuf_M;
00084 /* Index of read data mode */
00085 uint32_t RdIdx_M;
00086 /* Length of data */
00087 uint32_t DatLen_M;
00088 /* Master Rx Buffer */
00089 uint8_t Master_Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00090 
00091 
00092 /* These variable below are used in Slave SSP -------------------- */
00093 /* Write data pointer */
00094 uint8_t *pWrBuf_S;
00095 /* Index of write data mode */
00096 uint32_t WrIdx_S;
00097 /* Length of data */
00098 uint32_t DatLen_S;
00099 /* Slave Tx Buffer */
00100 uint8_t Slave_Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00101 /* Last command */
00102 uint8_t Last_cmd;

00105 uint8_t menu1[] =
00106 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00107 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00108 "SSP demo \n\r"
00109 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00110 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00111 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00112 " This example uses two SSP peripherals in MicroWire frame format \n\r"
00113 " \t one is set as master mode and the other is set as slave mode. \n\r"
00114 "\t The master and slave transfer a number of data bytes together \n\r"

00121 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00122 void ssp_MW_SendCMD(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx, uint8_t cmd);
00123 uint16_t ssp_MW_GetRSP(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx);
00124 uint8_t ssp_MW_GetCMD(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx);
00125 void ssp_MW_SendRSP(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx, uint16_t Rsp);

00130 
00131 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00132 /*********************************************************************/
00137 void ssp_MW_SendCMD(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx, uint8_t cmd)
00138 {
00139         // wait for current SSP activity complete
00140         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_BUSY) ==  SET);
00141 
00142         SSP_SendData(SSPx, (uint16_t) cmd);
00143 }
00144 
00145 /*********************************************************************/
00150 uint16_t ssp_MW_GetRSP(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx)
00151 {
00152         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY) == RESET);
00153         return (SSP_ReceiveData(SSPx));
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*********************************************************************/
00161 uint8_t ssp_MW_GetCMD(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx)
00162 {
00163         // Wait for coming CMD
00164         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY) == RESET);
00165 
00166         return ((uint8_t)(SSP_ReceiveData(SSPx)));
00167 }
00168 
00169 /*********************************************************************/
00174 void ssp_MW_SendRSP(LPC_SSP_TypeDef *SSPx, uint16_t Rsp)
00175 {
00176         // wait for current SSP activity complete
00177         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPx, SSP_STAT_BUSY) ==  SET);
00178 
00179         SSP_SendData(SSPx, Rsp);
00180 }
00181 
00182 /*********************************************************************/
00187 void Buffer_Init(void)
00188 {
00189         uint8_t i;
00190 
00191         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00192                 Slave_Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00193                 Master_Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00194         }
00195 
00196 }
00197 
00198 /*********************************************************************/
00203 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00204 {
00205         uint8_t i;
00206         uint8_t *pSTx = (uint8_t *) &Slave_Tx_Buf[0];
00207         uint8_t *pMRx = (uint8_t *) &Master_Rx_Buf[0];
00208 
00209         for ( i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++ )
00210         {
00211                 if (*pMRx++ != *pSTx++)
00212                 {
00213                         /* Call Error Loop */
00214                         Error_Loop();
00215                 }
00216         }
00217 }
00218 
00219 /*********************************************************************/
00224 void Error_Loop(void)
00225 {
00226         /* Loop forever */
00227         _DBG_("Verify fail!\n\r");
00228         while (1);
00229 }

00236 void print_menu(void)
00237 {
00238         _DBG(menu1);
00239 }

00242 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00243 /*********************************************************************/
00248 int c_entry(void)
00249 {
00250         uint32_t cnt;
00251         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00252 
00253         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00254          * – 115200bps
00255          * – 8 data bit
00256          * – No parity
00257          * – 1 stop bit
00258          * – No flow control
00259          */
00260         debug_frmwrk_init();
00261 
00262         // print welcome screen
00263         print_menu();
00264 
00265         /*
00266          * Initialize SSP pin connect
00267          * P0.6 - SSEL1
00268          * P0.7 - SCK1
00269          * P0.8 - MISO1
00270          * P0.9 - MOSI1
00271          */
00272         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00273         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00274         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00275         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00276         PinCfg.Pinnum = 6;
00277         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00278         PinCfg.Pinnum = 7;
00279         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00280         PinCfg.Pinnum = 8;
00281         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00282         PinCfg.Pinnum = 9;
00283         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00284 
00285 
00286         /*
00287          * Initialize SSP pin connect
00288          * P0.15 - SCK
00289          * P0.16 - SSEL
00290          * P0.17 - MISO
00291          * P0.18 - MOSI
00292          */
00293         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00294         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00295         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00296         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00297         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00298         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00299         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00300         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00301         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00302         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00303         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00304         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00305 
00306 
00307         /* Initializing Master SSP device section ------------------------------------------- */
00308         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00309         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00310         // Re-configure SSP to MicroWire frame format
00311         SSP_ConfigStruct.FrameFormat = SSP_FRAME_MICROWIRE;
00312         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00313         SSP_Init(SSPDEV_M, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00314 
00315         // Enable SSP peripheral
00316         SSP_Cmd(SSPDEV_M, ENABLE);
00317 
00318 
00319     /* Initializing Slave SSP device section ------------------------------------------- */
00320         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00321         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00322         /* Re-configure mode for SSP device */
00323         SSP_ConfigStruct.Mode = SSP_SLAVE_MODE;
00324         // Re-configure SSP to MicroWire frame format
00325         SSP_ConfigStruct.FrameFormat = SSP_FRAME_MICROWIRE;
00326         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00327         SSP_Init(SSPDEV_S, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00328 
00329         // Enable SSP peripheral
00330         SSP_Cmd(SSPDEV_S, ENABLE);
00331 
00332 
00333         /* Initializing Buffer section ------------------------------------------------- */
00334         Buffer_Init();
00335 
00336         /* Start Transmit/Receive between Master and Slave ----------------------------- */
00337         pRdBuf_M = (uint8_t *)&Master_Rx_Buf[0];
00338         RdIdx_M = 0;
00339         DatLen_M = BUFFER_SIZE;
00340         pWrBuf_S = (uint8_t *)&Slave_Tx_Buf[0];
00341         WrIdx_S = 0;
00342         DatLen_S = BUFFER_SIZE;
00343         /* Force Last command to Read command as default */
00344         Last_cmd = MicroWire_RD_CMD;
00345 
00346         /* Clear all remaining data in RX FIFO */
00347         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_M, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY))
00348         {
00349                 SSP_ReceiveData(SSPDEV_M);
00350         }
00351         while (SSP_GetStatus(SSPDEV_S, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY))
00352         {
00353                 SSP_ReceiveData(SSPDEV_S);
00354         }
00355 
00356         for (cnt = 0; cnt < BUFFER_SIZE; cnt++)
00357         {
00358                 /* The slave must initialize data in FIFO for immediately transfer from master
00359                  * due to last received command
00360                  */
00361                 if (Last_cmd == MicroWire_RD_CMD)
00362                 {
00363                         // Then send the respond to master, this contains data
00364                         ssp_MW_SendRSP(SSPDEV_S, (uint16_t) *(pWrBuf_S + WrIdx_S++));
00365                 }
00366                 else
00367                 {
00368                         // Then send the respond to master, this contains data
00369                         ssp_MW_SendRSP(SSPDEV_S, 0xFF);
00370                 }
00371                 /* Master must send a read command to slave,
00372                  * the slave then respond with its data in FIFO
00373                  */
00374                 ssp_MW_SendCMD(SSPDEV_M, MicroWire_RD_CMD);
00375 
00376                 // Master receive respond
00377                 *(pRdBuf_M + RdIdx_M++) = (uint8_t) ssp_MW_GetRSP(SSPDEV_M);
00378 
00379                 // Re-assign Last command
00380                 Last_cmd = ssp_MW_GetCMD(SSPDEV_S);
00381         }
00382 
00383         /* Verify buffer */
00384         Buffer_Verify();
00385 
00386         _DBG_("Verify success!\n\r");
00387 
00388     /* Loop forever */
00389     while(1);
00390     return 1;
00391 }
00392 
00393 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00394    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00395    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00396    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00397    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00398 int main(void)
00399 {
00400     return c_entry();
00401 }

00406 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00407 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00408 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00409 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00410 * @return               None
00411 *******************************************************************************/
00412 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00413 {
00414         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00415          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00416 
00417         /* Infinite loop */
00418         while(1);
00419 }
00420 #endif

00423  * @}
